whole_object: When trees secretly aspire to be telephone poles, they start branching out into new lines of communication.
single_object:
- Person1: Don't worry, I'm not going out on a limb here, but I think I might just branch out into tree-whispering!
- Person2: I'd tell you a joke about the sidewalk, but you've probably heard it before—it's all over town!
- Building: I'm not saying I'm popular, but I do have people climbing the walls to get in.
- Trees: We're not very good at leaf-ing. In fact, we tend to stick around for all seasons.
- Cars: We're on a roll, but every now and then, we tire out.
- Bicycle: I spoke too much at the wheel-meeting and now I'm two-tired.
- Sidewalk: I pride myself on being a concrete example of stability, even if I do crack up occasionally.
- Street: One could say I'm the pathway to success; everyone's always driving towards their goals on me.
- Streetlight: I'm not too bright during the day, but at night, I really shine!
multi_object:
- Person1  
- Person2  
- "Person1 told Person2 he was going to 'leaf' soon, but the trees were just too shady for that!"

- Person2  
- Cars  
- "Person2 was so excited to see the cars that he almost forgot to 'brake' for a chat!"

- Building  
- Trees  
- "The building was feeling a bit 'stumped' by the trees, wondering who had the better shade!"

- Trees  
- Sidewalk  
- "The trees were having a 'root' awakening, realizing the sidewalk was just a 'pavement' for their dreams!"

- Cars  
- Bicycle  
- "The cars were jealous of the bicycle, claiming it was just 'two-tired' to keep up with their speed!"

- Bicycle  
- Streetlight  
- "The bicycle asked the streetlight for directions, but all it got was a 'bright' idea!" 

- Sidewalk  
- Street  
- "The sidewalk was tired of being walked on and wanted to 'pave' its own way down the street!" 

- Street  
- Person1  
- "Person1 thought the street was a runway, but it just wanted to 'pave' the way for a smooth exit!" 

- Streetlight  
- Person2  
- "Person2 thought the streetlight was giving him the green light, but it was just 'flashing' its approval!"
